name: Tree Father Birch

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: I thought I was quite clear. Leave or we will be forced to take action!

topics.topic_text: I've never seen anyplace like this.
topics.response_text: No, I suppose you haven't. In fact, few who live outside of Oasis have.

topics.topic_text: Amazing, this place seems so abundant with animal life.
topics.response_text: The innocent creatures are drawn here by His gifts. They come from across the Wasteland to live in this sanctuary.

topics.topic_text: I can't explain it, but I can feel this place just teeming with life.
topics.response_text: That's His power you feel, Outsider. With His outstretched limbs He shelters us and keep us safe.

topics.topic_text: This place is weird. Where do you plug stuff in?
topics.response_text: Ha ha ha! We no longer use devices like that. We cast our technology away many years ago.

topics.topic_text: This place scares me. It's so... different.
topics.response_text: What you call scared, I call humbled. This place is a blessing to all of us.

topics.topic_text: Who is it you keep referring to as "Him"?
topics.response_text: He is the One Who Grows, He is the One Who Gives and He is the One Who Guides.

topics.topic_text: The way you're saying "Him," I could swear you're referring to a god...
topics.response_text: He's no mere god, my friend.

topics.topic_text: I wish you could just tell me who "He" is, already...
topics.response_text: He is the One Who Grows, He is the One Who Gives and He is the One Who Guides.

topics.topic_text: Can you cut the "Him" crap already and just tell me who he is?
topics.response_text: He is the One Who Grows, He is the One Who Gives and He is the One Who Guides.

topics.topic_text: Why do you call yourselves Treeminders?
topics.response_text: We care for this place and keep it safe from those who would seek to exploit it.

topics.topic_text: I may be willing to help, but I need straight answers about who "He" is.
topics.response_text: I would have preferred that He made the introduction, but I understand your hesitation.

topics.topic_text: Treeminders, huh? That's a strange name.
topics.response_text: Is it so strange to care for one's home and keep it safe from those who would seek to exploit it?

topics.topic_text: I think you're all a bunch of lunatics.
topics.response_text: Ha ha ha. I don't expect you to understand everything you see here. After all, you carry the taint of technology upon you.

topics.topic_text: If you hate technology, why carry weapons?
topics.response_text: Sadly, the Wasteland is a hostile place and sometimes we're forced to defend ourselves against it.

topics.topic_text: Shun technology? How do you defend yourselves?
topics.response_text: The Wasteland is a hostile place and sometimes we're forced to defend ourselves against it.

topics.topic_text: Yeah, sure. I guess that's why Maple stuck a rifle in my face...
topics.response_text: Listen my friend, I will forgive your insolent tone because He has asked to see you.

topics.topic_text: Okay, let's begin the ceremony.
topics.response_text: Very good! Take your place in front of the basin and let's begin.

topics.topic_text: Could we wait just a bit? I'm not quite ready.
topics.response_text: I understand, my friend. Preparing to meet Him takes much preparation and soul searching.

topics.topic_text: Forget this whole thing. This is insane!
topics.response_text: Then you are free to go. He had requested to see you, but He said not to take you against your will.

topics.topic_text: Which brings us to why I'm here, I suppose.
topics.response_text: Yes. Indeed it does. Sorry I don't speak to Outsiders very often and I tend to get lost in conversation.

topics.topic_text: So what was all this about meeting someone?
topics.response_text: Yes, my apologies. I don't speak to Outsiders very often and I tend to get lost in conversation.

topics.topic_text: Fine, fine. Get to the point already.
topics.response_text: You have much to learn about patience, my friend. However, you are correct, I will get to the point.

topics.topic_text: I would be honored to meet this person.
topics.response_text: Yes... person.{Almost to yourself as if musing.}

topics.topic_text: And where can I find this person?
topics.response_text: Yes... person.{Almost to yourself as if musing.}

topics.topic_text: Okay already. Let's get this going.
topics.response_text: To meet Him, you must undergo the Ceremony of Purification. Once that's complete, you'll be able to speak to Him.

topics.topic_text: Just a minute... What does this ceremony involve?
topics.response_text: It's simple really. You drink the Sap from the basin here in the Pavilion.

topics.topic_text: Hang on, you never said anything about a ceremony!
topics.response_text: There's no reason to be alarmed.

topics.topic_text: Can't we skip all this nonsense?
topics.response_text: I'm afraid not. No one gets to see Him without first drinking the Sap from the basin here in the Pavilion.

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry, I'm ready now.
topics.response_text: Then please, return to the basin and we will begin.

topics.topic_text: I've changed my mind. I'm not quite ready.
topics.response_text: There's nothing to fear here. This is our tradition and our custom, as well as a measure of protection for Him.

topics.topic_text: I'm leaving. This is just crazy.
topics.response_text: Then you are free to go. He had requested to see you, but He said not to take you against your will.

topics.topic_text: I was glad to do it. Oasis needs to be protected.
topics.response_text: In your short visit here I can see you've learned much. That's a rare gift in these turbulent times.

topics.topic_text: Sure, I guess.
topics.response_text: Perhaps you haven't learned quite as much as I hoped from your visit here, but I'm glad to see you made the right choice in the end.

topics.topic_text: I could have used a pile of caps instead, but whatever.
topics.response_text: I'm saddened that worldly possessions and wealth still drive you, but I'm glad to see you made the right choice in the end.

topics.topic_text: I have to say I'm surprised you aren't angrier with me.
topics.response_text: Before you reached His heart, He imparted his last words to me. He told me about his will to die and how I mistook this for some mystical sign.

topics.topic_text: And here I thought you'd be ready to kill me.
topics.response_text: No, Outsider, my anger lay not with you, but with myself.

topics.topic_text: Welcome back to the Wasteland, asshole.
topics.response_text: You're words sting, Outsider. Normally I'd have you cast from this place for such a statement, but my eyes have been opened.

topics.topic_text: What will become of Oasis?
topics.response_text: Even though the Great One has left us, our memories of Him will never die.

topics.topic_text: You'll make due.
topics.response_text: Even though the Great One has left us, our memories of Him will never die.

topics.topic_text: I could care less about your problems. I'm out of here.
topics.response_text: Your words carry no remorse, no caring.

topics.topic_text: I'm afraid Harold isn't a god. He's just a human that had some bad luck.
topics.response_text: Oh, He's testing you now, just like He tested us!

topics.topic_text: He's not a god, Birch. His name's Harold.
topics.response_text: Oh, He's testing you now, just like He tested us!

topics.topic_text: Can we just dispense with all of the religious crap? His name's Harold!
topics.response_text: Oh, He's testing you now, just like He tested us!

topics.topic_text: Did you know your god wants me to kill him?
topics.response_text: Yes, I've been pondering that riddle myself for some time now and I think I know what He's trying to tell us.

topics.topic_text: Harold makes unusual requests.
topics.response_text: The Great One does tend to speak in riddles, but if that is His way, then so be it.

topics.topic_text: Are you aware that Harold wants to die?
topics.response_text: Yes, I've been pondering that riddle myself for some time now and I think I know what He's trying to tell us.

topics.topic_text: You don't scare me Birch, and neither does that overgrown weed you call a god.
topics.response_text: That's it! You are no longer welcome in Oasis! Get out IMMEDIATELY!

topics.topic_text: So what can I do to help?
topics.response_text: If the same sap that you drank to purify yourself could be applied to His heart, it should stop the spread.

topics.topic_text: Killing him should stop his influence from spreading.
topics.response_text: You misinterpret His words, my friend. He wants you to extinguish that which seeks to make Him vulnerable.

topics.topic_text: You don't scare me Birch, and neither does that overgrown weed you call a god.
topics.response_text: That's it! You are no longer welcome in Oasis! Get out IMMEDIATELY!

topics.topic_text: Just a minute. Who are you and what is this place?
topics.response_text: I'm sorry, in my excitement, I got ahead of myself.

topics.topic_text: I'm not following anyone until I know what's going on here.
topics.response_text: I'm sorry, in my excitement, I got ahead of myself.

topics.topic_text: Ha ha ha! What the hell are you wearing?
topics.response_text: I am wearing the clothes of a Treeminder. We shed our Wasteland garments like the ones you're wearing long ago.

topics.topic_text: Whoa, whoa. Slow down, old man. What the hell are you babbling about?
topics.response_text: I'm sorry, in my excitement, I got ahead of myself.

topics.topic_text: Sure, lead on.
topics.response_text: Excellent! Please, follow me. All will be explained soon.

topics.topic_text: Who's waiting for me inside?
topics.response_text: Why, He is of course.

topics.topic_text: The Treeminders?
topics.response_text: Yes, we're the Treeminders. We're His people.

topics.topic_text: I'm not following anyone. I need to be on my way.
topics.response_text: I can promise you that if you leave, you'll be missing out on a great honor. Not many have even seen Him before, and yet he wants to speak to you.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll follow you. Lead on.
topics.response_text: Excellent! Please, follow me. All will be explained soon.

topics.topic_text: No way! You're obviously out of your mind!
topics.response_text: I'm very saddened to hear that, a great opportunity like this may come only once in a lifetime.

topics.topic_text: Perhaps some other time. I have more urgent matters to attend to.
topics.response_text: I'm very saddened to hear that, a great opportunity like this may come only once in a lifetime.

topics.topic: MS10FinTLRewardTree Father Birch said you may have a gift for me?
topics.topic_text: You said someone had gifts for me?
topics.response_text: Yes, I believe Branchtender Maple, Branchtender Cypress and my little Yew mentioned they had some things for you as gifts.

topics.topic_text: Any information you could give me on the caves below Oasis would be helpful.
topics.response_text: Just like a cancer would infest our bodies, the caves below us are infested with vermin.

topics.topic_text: I'm ready to undertake the ceremony.
topics.response_text: Very good! Take your place in front of the basin and let's begin.

topics.topic_text: What will you do now?
topics.response_text: I will do my best to honor the Great One's memory by tending this place until my dying day.

topics.topic_text: I have some questions about the task you gave me.
topics.response_text: By all means, ask away.

topics.topic_text: Why don't you just travel to Harold's heart on your own?
topics.response_text: I would if I was able, but He will not allow us entry. His roots bar the door, and we have yet to earn the right to pass.

topics.topic_text: Were you aware that Laurel gave me this Liniment?
topics.response_text: Of course I am. I know everything that goes on in Oasis. Laurel is free to pursue whatever path she chooses.

topics.topic_text: Where did the sap come from?
topics.response_text: Bloomseer Poplar has a unique understanding of the innate power that lay dormant in the plants you see around you.

topics.topic_text: Where is the entrance to the caves?
topics.response_text: You'll find the entrance in the southwestern part of Oasis.

topics.topic: MS10TLTreeminderWhat did you have to do to become a Treeminder?
topics.topic_text: May I ask you about the Treeminders?
topics.response_text: Of course. We're quite open about everything here.

topics.topic_text: How did the Treeminders begin?
topics.response_text: When I first beheld the glory of the Great One, I knew there'd be others who would seek to do Him harm.

topics.topic_text: How do the Treeminders normally handle other Outsiders?
topics.response_text: If the Outsider doesn't have His blessing, we simply deny him entry to our home.

topics.topic_text: Could I become a Treeminder?
topics.response_text: Becoming a disciple of the Great One takes many years of dedication and the will to cast aside your reliance on technological conveniences.

topics.topic_text: Your names are quite strange. What do they mean?
topics.response_text: The first part of our name represents our role in the Treeminders. The youngest are the Saplings, still learning what it means to live in Oasis.

topics.topic_text: If this place has living plants, does that mean the water is safe to drink?
topics.response_text: I'm afraid the water still bears the mark of man's greed. It's His reminder of what we once were.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to ask about something else.
topics.response_text: Go on.

description:
Tree Father Birch is a 75 year-old Caucasian Male.

Birch is the spiritual and temporal leader of the Treeminders, a cult that worships Harold, the 'god-spirit' in the form of a giant tree. He spends most of his time in the Pavilion, sitting on his throne, occasionally eating, and sleeping for a few hours at night. He also walks around Oasis, overseeing the village more directly.

Tree Father Birch's Personality: Birch is wise, calm, and authoritative, embodying the spiritual essence of the Treeminders. He is deeply devoted to Harold and his teachings, and he expects the same devotion from his followers. He can be secretive and protective of Oasis, viewing outsiders with suspicion until they prove their worthiness.

Tree Father Birch's Backstory: Birch was once a wanderer in the Capitol Wasteland, searching for meaning in the desolate world. One day, he stumbled upon Oasis and Harold, the sentient tree. Fascinated by Harold's wisdom and the lush oasis in the middle of the wasteland, Birch decided to stay and became one of Harold's first followers. Over time, he rose to become the leader of the Treeminders, guiding the cult in their communion with Harold and expanding the village of Oasis.
